Reviews.Title: You get exactly what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: Gerome E.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV back in late 2010.  The product looks very nice and has that modern "feel" to it.  All of the TV's options are touch-sensitive buttons for volume,  channel, and power.  On the side, the TV has a cable output, VGA and audio input for computers, and a headphone jack.  On the back, there is space for component/AV cables.Picture Quality:The picture quality is not the greatest, but it is exactly what you pay for.  You are still getting 1080p output, but i suggest changing the sharpness higher in a custom template.  This dramatically improved the quality, especially in gaming.Sound Quality:The sound quality is decent, but maybe the worst of any HDTV.  First of all, the sound at "Volume 1" is extremely low while moving it to "Volume 2" seems loud, especially when others are trying to sleep.  Your best bet is to find some computer speakers which will plug in easily into the headphone jacks or just wearing headphones.  Once again, the sound is just terrible.Product Design:The overall design is great!  The TV is very thin which allows more space.  One flaw about the TV is the base of the TV.  The stand constantly moves a lot and is not stable.  As long as you do not touch the TV too much, it should be fine.  While looking up other reviews, this is how every stand was made for this product.Overall, the HDTV deserves a 4 star rating for its good picture quality and its sleek design.  Although the sound may be its biggest downfall, a pair of computer speakers fixes the problem.

Reviews.Title: bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Key West Dave
Reviews.Content: I finally had to replace an old CRT in the master bedroom.  With limited space on a wall mounted shelf this DYNEX TV was the best combination of size and price.  Great value for what I needed.

Reviews.Title: used
Reviews.Author: customer
Reviews.Content: I got it as a Christmas present "used". And I havent had any problems. Picture and sound is good. Good

Reviews.Title: It's exactly as advertised
Reviews.Author: Hong Ouyang
Reviews.Content: It's a decent 24 inch TV that is a cheap alternative and also a great monitor. I've used it as a second computer monitor for a year now and it's been decent to me. Almost no problems, though I haven't really seen anything in 1080p on it when on TV, but I think that's because of my own TV channels not being in HD.For what it's worth, it's definitely a decent buy.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Patty Sabella
Reviews.Content: The Dynex tv arrived packaged in its manufacturer's box, safe and sound. We put it in our guest room, connected it, and voila! Great picture, perfect size for bedroom, sleek design, can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: Good 24" LED
Reviews.Author: Cincy Domer
Reviews.Content: As a technology rental company we are very picky about the quality and versatility of our gear.  In addition, many of our customers prefer big brand names.  But the Dynex 24" LED does a great job of accepting multiple video sources and produces an  excellent picture.  Unlike many other smaller monitors (under 32") the Dynex speakers produce surprisingly high quality sound.  It is a little tricky to get it to fill the screen at certain lower end PC resolutions, but for TV or DVD use this monitor is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: 24" Monitor TV
Reviews.Author: Bedeck
Reviews.Content: I use the TV for an expanded computor monitor and works well for my purpose Good resolution and functionality. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: used Dynex 24' 1080p led lcd tv
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: I needed this particular model TV and the seller had it available at a very reasonable price.  After ordering, I waited to see what would happen.  It arrived right on time, the seller was quite prompt in shipping it out. The box was sized very well to fit the product and was clearly marked "fragile" and "this way up". The top of the box was torn a bit however, despite the warning. The product was securely packaged inside and had no damage. After unpacking, I found everything promised was there, stand, remote and tv. Hooked up and plugged in and tv worked perfectly. For a small type of tv this has a a very sharp and clear picture, due to the 1080p and the led backlighting. I am quite pleased, and recommend the seller MPM Products for your needs.

Reviews.Title: Short Life - Not Worth It
Reviews.Author: jalfonso475
Reviews.Content: I basically got what I paid for - under 2 years service out of the TV.Poor sound quality due to rear facing speakers.  Hooking up external speakers was necessary for decent sound.After under 2 years of mid-range use (couple hours a day at most), volume went to 100 on its own and unable to lower it or get into menu to make any adjustments.I'll recycle it at the Best Buy where I bought it and will move on to another brand

Reviews.Title: Excels at intended purpose - but quirky
Reviews.Author: Columbus-techie
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality, color, and performance for the price.  The fairly sturdy and surprisingly slim design has basic needs stereo audio speakers which are understandably limited in range and volume.  They are however surprisingly capable in small to medium-sized rooms (kitchen).  There are adequate ports/connectors for most audio/video devices. Minor gripes: For rare instances when you use the front interface, the physical buttons (actually "touch spots" ) are incredibly difficult to see, and are oddly positioned opposite the natural direction of the navigation on the screen.  i.e.  Volume Up is on the left and Volume Down is on the right - which inclines you to press the exact opposite.  All adjustment buttons are reversed as such. Changing channels often results in a lag or delay of a few seconds - insignificant to some, intolerable to others.  Final "entertaining" annoyance is the range of the remote.  Despite new batteries, still limited to 10' max (direct line of site). Beyond that distance, the remote must be skillfully aimed at the sensor.  Mounting the unit higher on the wall (despite tilting appropriately) seems to exacerbate the problem.  Still recommended, if the aforementioned issues are tolerable for your intended use.

Reviews.Title: Dynex 24inch
Reviews.Author: G. Stanley
Reviews.Content: For the money it is okay. I don't like the sound. It's tingy, (the best way I can describe). Not thrilled with the picture either. I have cannot get it were I like it. Sometimes it gets too dark. But, like everything, you get what you pay for.
